alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 8:44PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NORTHAMPTON... WESTERN GREENSVILLE...MECKLENBURG...SOUTHEASTERN LUNENBURG... SOUTHWESTERN DINWIDDIE AND BRUNSWICK COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM EDT... At 844 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 9 miles southeast of Boydton, or 13 miles northwest of Warrenton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Northampton, western Greensville, Mecklenburg, southeastern Lunenburg, southwestern Dinwiddie and Brunswick Counties, including the following locations... Bacons Fork, Wilburn, Gum Forks, Dolphin, Bowens Corner, Pleasant Shade, Henrico, Forksville, Fairview, and Rogers Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
